blogs.title: React-Redux
blogs.body: react-redux is a library that provides React bindings for the Redux state management library. It allows you to use Redux in your React apps by providing a way to connect your React components to the Redux store and dispatch actions.

blogs.title: JSON server
blogs.body: JSON Server is a simple tool that allows you to create a fake REST API by defining the endpoints and the data in a JSON file. It is often used for prototyping or as a way to mock a back-end server during the development of a front-end application.

blogs.title: useNavigate Hook
blogs.body: The useNavigate hook is a function that is part of the @reach/router library in React. It allows you to navigate to a new location in your application programmatically, by calling the navigate function that is returned by the hook.

blogs.title: useParams hook
blogs.body:
useParams is a hook in the react-router-dom library that allows a functional component to access the dynamic pieces of the URL in a React app. It is a way to get access to the parameters in the URL that are being used to render a particular route.

To use useParams, you will need to import it from react-router-dom and then call it inside your functional component. It returns an object containing the key-value pairs of the dynamic segments of the URL that is being used to render the current route

blogs.title: ChatGPT
blogs.body: ChatGPT is a platform to search on
